summary: Nearly 26 million people in the United States rely on federally funded health centers for care, much of which is supported by grants from the Health Resources and Services Administration (HRSA). The centers are prohibited from using federal funds for abortions unless the pregnancy is the result of rape or incest, or the woman's life is endangered. title: Health Resources and Services Administration: Efforts to Help Ensure Health Center Compliance with Prohibitions on the Use of Federal Funds for Certain Abortions
